intro: Legousia falcata var. scabra, commonly known as the rough leaved legousia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
